Description: Fragment of an undyed linen tunic? in plain weave, with remains of the neck opening, which is decorated with two tapestry bands, applied and sewn (oversewing); the selvedge of the plain weave under the tapestry appears to be preserved or hemmed in some places; one band of tapestry has been applied to the lower part of the opening - the two selvedge are preserved, one edge is cut and ragged and the other edge is hidden by the other tapestry, this has been applied and sewn to follow the curve of the neck opening, the decoration is of stylised motifs (vegetal or flowers?) placed either side of a geometric freize, motifs are multi-coloured on a red background and at the lower part is a freize of stylised human faces in oink and yellow on a purple background; a second band of tapetry has been applied over the upper part of the neck opening and lies slightly above the first band, one selvedge is preserved and reinforced on a warp thread, the edge following the neck opening has been hemmed and sewn, the rest is ragged, the decoration is similar to the other band, with the same geometric and stylised vegetal motifs, it is framed with a freize of stylised human faces on a blue background; plain weave: warp?-undyed linen (Z/7), weft?-undyed linen (S/10); tapestry on grouped threads: warp-undyed linen (S spun Z ply/11), weft-undyed linen (S/56), yellow, red, light and dark green, light and dark blue, pink wool (S/52); 'lying threads' in yellow wool (S); extra threads in bleached linen (S); sewing threads in undyed linen (S spun Z ply)
Curator's comments: stored in black box; kept with a small bag with extra fibres
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
